lines.gurmukhi: crn kml rj mjn kY idib dyh mhw mlmUqR DwrI inrMkwrI kIny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Raj Majan Kai Dibi Dayha , Mahaa Malamootr Dhaaree Nirankaaree Keenay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Bathing in the holy dust of the True Guru's feet, the body of an individual acquires golden hue. One who is evil of thoughts, becomes Guru-oriented and divine of temperaments.

lines.gurmukhi: crn kml crnwmiRq inDwn pwn qiRgun AqIq cIq Awpw Awp cIny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Charanaamrit Nidhaan Paana , Trigoun Ateet Cheet Aapaa Aap Cheenay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By relishing the elixir of the True Guru's feet, the mind is freed from the triple traits of maya (mammon). He then recognises his self.

lines.gurmukhi: crn kml inj Awsn isMGwsn kY qiRBvn Aau qiRkwl gMimqw pRbIny hY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Nij Aasan Singhaasan Kai , Tribhavan Au Trikaal Ganmitaa Prabeenay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By instilling the lotus-like holy feet of the True Guru in self, I.e. mind, one becomes aware of all the three times and the three worlds.

lines.gurmukhi: crn kml rs gMD rUp sIqlqw duqIAw nwsiq eyk tyk ilv lIny hY ]338]
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Ras Gandh Roop Seetalataa , Douteeaa Naasati Ayk Tayk Liv Leenay Hai ?338?

Shabad OS B.translation: By relishing the coolness, sweetness, fragrance and beauty of the lotus-like feet of the True Guru, the duality disappears from the mind. One remains absorbed in the refuge and support of the holy feet (of the True Guru). (338)
